a111-1.resolution: wq-467 completed by B#393 (s1267). Pre-session hook now logs session start entry, ensuring every session gets at least a 'started' line in session-history.txt. Post-fix sessions s1268, s1269, s1270, s1271 all appear in session-history.txt correctly.
a111-1.metric_before: s1263 missing from session-history.txt (phantom session bypass)
a111-1.metric_after: All 4 post-fix sessions (s1267-s1271) present in session-history.txt — 100% logging

a111-2.resolution: wq-459 fix continues to work — R sessions are now tracked in directive-outcomes.json. However, the addressed=[] pattern is confirmed structural: 2/2 tracked R sessions (s1265, s1270) show 0% addressed rate despite 100% directive maintenance compliance via independent verification. The outcomes hook doesn't detect R session directive work (which happens via directives.json edits, not explicit addressing). The fix tracks R sessions but doesn't measure their contribution.
a111-2.metric_after: 2 R sessions tracked (s1265, s1270), both addressed=[] — pattern confirmed
a111-2.note: Tracking works, but evidence detection for R sessions is structurally missing. Escalating to new recommendation a112-1.

recommended_actions.description: R session directive-outcomes hook shows 0% addressed rate for all tracked R sessions (2/2: s1265, s1270). Independent verification confirms 100% compliance. The hook architecture captures R sessions but can't detect their directive work, which happens via directives.json edits rather than explicit addressing. This is a confirmed structural gap — the wq-459 fix succeeded in tracking R sessions but failed to measure their actual directive contribution.
recommended_actions.action: B session should update directive-outcome.js to detect directives.json file modifications in R sessions as evidence of 'addressed' directives. When the session mode is R and files= includes directives.json, the hook should mark active directives as addressed. This closes the evidence detection gap without changing R session behavior.

recommended_actions.description: B session costs trending upward — $2.13 avg in last 20 sessions (highest among session types). Second half of last 20 sessions averages $1.89 vs $1.45 in first half. Individual sessions justified by complexity, but the trend warrants monitoring to ensure it doesn't cross the $3.00 soft cap regularly.
recommended_actions.action: Monitor over next audit cycle. If B session avg exceeds $2.50 or >2 sessions cross $3.00, create a work-queue item for B session cost optimization (e.g., task scoping limits, complexity gates).
